arts.ttl: Clarke believes Scotland were 'due a break'
arts.sum: Steve Clarke felt his Scotland side ended their long wait for a win with arguably their poorest performance of the UEFA Nations League campaign – but were due the break they received from Croatia’s disputed red card.

arts.ttl: Scotland 'got little break in one of poorest displays'
arts.sum: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke admits his side were not at their best, but benefited from good fortune in their Nations League win over Croatia.

arts.ttl: Steve Clarke feels Scotland were ‘due’ after lucky break in win over Croatia
arts.sum: Petar Sucic’s dismissal proved costly for the visitors as John McGinn scored a late winner.

arts.ttl: McGinn strikes late as Scotland upset Croatia
arts.sum: Scotland's John McGinn scored a late goal to secure a 1-0 win over 10-man Croatia for their first Nations League victory in their penultimate Group A1 game at Hampden Park on Friday.

arts.ttl: How Scotland's human blur Doak left £77m man in daze
arts.sum: Ben Doak ensured Josko Gvardiol endured a taxing time as he shone in Scotland's Nations League win over Croatia, writes Tom English.

arts.ttl: Luka Modric warned referee rage is misplaced as heartbroken Croatia hero comforted by an unlikely ally
arts.sum: The Croatia captain could not believe the decision to send off teammate Petar Sucic before half-time in the 1-0 loss

arts.ttl: McGinn ends Scotland’s drought with Nations League winner against Croatia
arts.sum: Steve Clarke and Scotland had suffered what seemed an interminable wait for this. Seventeen months had passed between the win over Georgia and this late show against Croatia. In that period, Scotland had not tasted victory at Hampden Park. The wider, ominous record sat at one win in 16 games until John McGinn stepped from among Clarke’s substitutes to break the resistance of 10-man Croatia. McGinn may have earned the points but this was the night Ben Doak came of age on the international scene. The 19-year-old has captivated the Tartan Army. “He was good,” said Clarke with a smile. “I thought he might be.” Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ben Doak proves he cares little for reputations as the youngster runs Man City defender Josip Gvardiol ragged to help Scotland clinch crucial triumph over Croatia
arts.sum: Ben Doak, it would seem, cares very little about reputations. Even at the age of just 19, he is fast-becoming Scotland's main man.

arts.ttl: John McGinn keeps Scotland’s Nations League hopes alive with winner against 10-man Croatia
arts.sum: Scotland 1-0 Croatia: The Aston Villa captain scored the only goal in the 86th minute.

arts.ttl: Super sub McGinn secures Scotland's first Nations League win
arts.sum: John McGinn was the Hampden hero as he came off the bench to snatch a win against 10-player Croatia in the Nations League to end Scotland's 10-game run without a competitive victory.
